name: Reset
author: Smartzminds

sections.description:
The ‘Reset Database Plugin,’ a product of expert WordPress Plugin Development, allows you to reset your website to its factory settings, including the removal of all media files and content modifications. This plugin is an invaluable tool for plugin and theme creators. Resetting returns your site to its default state, even if you had previously selected and activated a different theme. Active plugins are deactivated, and all internal data, such as custom posts, pages, and specific database tables, can be cleared by clicking the reset button. It’s the ultimate WordPress database reset plugin for comprehensive website management.

⚡️ FEATURES

  • Quick, one-click WordPress reset tool
  • Options for the entire database or specific tables
  • Reset includes custom posts and pages
  • Ability to clear a specific table from the database
  • Option to delete and deactivate selected plugins
  • Post comments will be deleted after clicking the reset button

⚡️ ATTRIBUTES

The principal attributes of this plugin are:

  • Speed: Resetting the WordPress database is a remarkably quick one-click procedure.
  • Safe: You can’t unintentionally click reset. It contains a confirmation-style text.
  • Confirmation Role: There must be typing confirmation. The alert notice appears if you enter incorrect information rather than choosing the reset text option.
  • Text to enter: You can write the reset to allow the user to reset the database.
  • Role of the reset database button: When the reset data button is clicked, the WordPress data is reset to its default settings, with all active plugins turned off, the default theme activated, and all of your pages and posts deleted, among other things.

🚀 TYPICAL USE CASES

How to make use of a plugin’s features:

  1. It is first important to install and activate the plugin.
  2. It is available on the WP-Admin Dashboard as a distinct menu.
  3. With the help of Tabs, all functions are completed.
  4. In the first tab, User can reset the whole database without loosing its conection.
  5. The user can choose whether they want to remove a specific table from the database or pick a number of tables to do so in the second tab.
  6. The user wants to pick several plugins to uninstall and deactivate by clicking the third tab.
  7. Themes can be deleted, deactivated, and back to their default settings on the fourth tab.
  8. By clicking on the fifth tab user can delete all the post comments with one click.
  9. A typing confirmation is required. If wrong information is entered rather than selecting the reset text option, the error message is displayed.
  10. To enable users to reset all the respective functionalities, you can write the “reset” word in the field.
  11. After that, Click the ‘Reset’ button for all the functionalities to reset the data.
  12. Your data will appear to be in its original state after the database has been reset.

Screenshots

Please take a moment to look at the screenshot below so you may use plugins without any hesitation.

  1. When you upload the plugin, click “activate” to make it live.
  2. After activation, it appears on the admin dashboard as a distinct menu.
  3. You’ll see that all the features are presented to you as tabs.
  4. The entire database can be reset in the first tab without losing connection by the user.
  5. In the second tab, the user can select one or more tables to remove from the database, depending on their preferences.
  6. By selecting the third option, the user want to select a number of plugins for uninstalling and deactivating.
  7. On the fourth tab, themes can be deleted, deactivated, and reset to their default settings.
  8. Users can quickly and easily erase all post comments by selecting the fifth tab.
  9. There must be a typing confirmation for each functionality in all tabs. The error notice appears if you enter incorrect information rather than choosing the reset text option.
  10. You can write the “reset” to allow user to reset all the functionalities according to your wishes. When the Reset button is clicked, the WordPress data is reset to its default settings, with all active plugins turned off, the default theme activated, and all of your pages and posts deleted, all plugins are going to be delete and deactivate and delete all the post comments.

Minimum requirements for Duplicate Page

  • WordPress 3.3+
  • PHP 5.x
  • MySQL 5.x

If any problem occurs, please contact us at support@smartzminds.com.
